event.description: Follow Jacob Marley's heroic behind-the-scenes efforts to save the soul of Scrooge, everyones favorite curmudgeonand in the process, save his own. This irreverent, funny and, ultimately, deeply moving story retells Dickens' Christmas Carol with warmth and infectious zest. Its great fun, an audience pleaser filled with laughs and capped with, of course, a happy ending...among the best evenings of the theatrical year! Chicago Tribune DEC 10: live-description performance for the partially sighted and blind DEC 17: ASL-interpreted performance for the Deaf (sponsored by Haywood Real Estate) Directed by Guy Fauchon, stage managed by Susan Currie, and starring Laura Di Cicco, Beth Gunderson, David C. Jones, and Adam Francis Proulx.
event.title: Jacob Marley's Christmas Carol, by Tom Mula

event.description: Revel in the pure, unadulterated meaning of Christmas with the live original score of A Charlie Brown Christmas, performed by renowned drummer Jerry Granelli - the only surviving member of the Vince Guaraldi Trio - who wrote and performed A Charlie Brown Christmas' memorable soundtrack. Simon Fisk and Chris Gestrin round out Granellis trio. A childrens choir will perform their parts of this seasonal special.
event.title: Jerry Granelli

event.description: Yoga & Meditation Workshop. Being Present is key to staying mindful in daily life. At the holiday season, being in the moment becomes especially challenging as we have so many things to do, places to be, and people to see. But ironically, being present is key to make the most of the time we have with our loved ones and staying calm despite the pressures we face. Throughout this workshop Kushok and Michelle will lead you in yoga and meditative practices to explore being present and learning how to maintain this awareness in daily life.
event.price: Pre-registration required. See web site for details.
event.title: Being Present

event.description: Rosie & the Riveters are four fiercely talented and sassy dames from Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, who perform uplifting folk music with a vintage 1940s flair! Their original songs feature sophisticated harmonies, body percussion, scintillating dance moves, humour and just enough ooh-la-la to charm your socks off! Along with whoops, hollers, and mile-wide smiles, they create a sound and sight that is lighthearted and captivating for all music lovers.They are inspired by Rosie the Riveter, the feminist icon who represents the womens movement into the workforce during WWII and embodies the strength and power that thrive in every woman. The Riveters are about empowering women to be ambassadors for change in their community and to attain this goal, they use 20% of their merchandise sales to support other womens projects around the world through KIVA.org.Since the bands formation in 2011, they have quickly taken the folk scene by storm! They have performed over 150 concerts across Canada and the United States, showcased at such events as Folk Alliance International, JunoFest, Folk Music Canada, been featured at numerous festivals and participated in workshops with artists such as Serena Ryder, Arlo Guthrie, The Bros. Landreth, and Kat Danser.Alexis Normand, Allyson Reigh, Melissa Nygren, and Farideh Olsen are the charming women who make up Rosie & the Riveters.
event.title: Rosie & The Riveters

event.description: While sitting around a table this spring, having an intimate group conversation, several of us began sharing our Big Lies....those untruths that we use as an excuse to stay stuck, remain indecisive and keep others comfortable, at the expense of our own individual happiness and potential. The outcome of this conversation was that many of us took the question "What is your Big Lie" with us to dinner parties, networking events, coffee dates and family dinners. The stories that came forth, the truths that were discovered and the connections that were made were astounding and remarkable. We were so excited by the conversations, ideas and movement forward that we witnessed that the logical next step was to offer this conversation, AND a solution to a larger audience of Women and Men.   So.... What is your Big Lie?   * The Big Lie is a story you have adopted as the truth, so you act it out on a daily basis and keep hitting replay. * Playing out your Big Lie keeps you small, stuck and on repeat instead of moving forward into your truth. * Your Big Lie can negativley infiltrate your relationships, career and even your passions or true path.   Often, on the other side of your Biggest Lie, lives your greatest gift and calling. Find out how you can conquer your Big Lie and Live out a New Truth.   If you are ready to: -Improve your Relationships at home and at work - Step into Your Truth -Immediately Move Forward in a Meaningful Way   Join us. Saturday, November 26, 2016 10 am-3 pm Cardel Theatre, Calgary Alberta   In this full-day interactive workshop, you'll; -Spend the day in a Safe Environment with Amazing Women and Men -Get Clear on the Story or the Lie that you may not realize keeps you on repeat, and getting the results you've always gotten. -Participate in practical exercises -Make meaningful connections with others -Leave with tangible take-aways, including;  -A 3-5 part action plan to help you take the most important steps in redrafting a new reality  ( we'll all participate in taking your first step, in the workshop setting!)   Your Investment of $155 includes; -all materials -instruction and facilitation -lunch **Register before October 15 and pay only $135 Your Faciliators: Shandra Carlson   Shandra is a certified coach, facilitator and speaker dedicated to the work of redefining identity and purpose for athletes, veterans, retirees or anyone faced with life altering transitions. As an award winning leader and motivator, her portfolio life also includes writing and finding hidden messages in everyday life.Drowning in mediocrity and boredom is not Shandra's idea of fulfilment. Her ability to communicate enthusiasm, even in adverse circumstances, draws others to consider new ideas and personal growth as part of their own pursuit of a life well-lived.Shandra's innate ability to connect at a deep level, while putting others at ease in their own process, fulfills the sense of purpose that drives her to help others discover theirs.   Lana Wright   Lana is the founder of Womentum, a community for women which allows them to show up authentically to be seen, heard, understood and celebrated. Lana is also a writer, speaker, podcaster, collaborator,  forward movement cheerleader and professional "but"-kicker.  She has a gift of creating safe, inclusive environments for people to connect and speak their truth freely, while being fully accepted.  It is her wish that all people are reminded of their potential, personal power and ability to create and maintain meaningful relationships, while honouring their personal boundaries and relationship with self.    Cancellation Policy: After September 1st no refunds will be given. Prior to that an administration fee of $15 will be charged for cancellations. Please ensure you are available for the whole workshop. If you are unable to join us after you have formally registered, your spot is fully transferrable to another person.   Payment: If you require a payment plan, please email Lana at lana@wearewomentum.com
event.title: The Big Lie

event.description: Learn to sign about "animals", "toys", "manners", "outside" and more in this fun 4 week class Long before your baby can speak, they have the ability to understand speech and they want to communicate with you. Typically babies are able to sign back to you between 9 and 11 months of age but can understand much of what you sign to them before that!  Since 2001, WeeHands has been an industry-leading children's sign language and language development program delivered through interactive, fun classes, as well as a line of tailored products. In 2014, WeeHands became part of Morneau Shepell’s Children’s Support Solutions, an organization that provides health-centered and educational services to children with differences to help them reach their potential.  Instructor: Katherine Fisher $80 per family (baby and 2 caregivers) A minimum of 75 ASL signs taught over FOUR 45 mins. classes  Learning to sign with your baby is as easy as waving "bye-bye" Improves language and vocabulary development! Lessens babies frustration and crying! Families are encouraged to register and come together! Appropriate for infants 0-12 months (the earlier you start, the better!)
event.title: Sign & Sing At Play! (Treasure Island Toys)

event.description: The End of the Line jam is best little jam on a Tuesday night in the whole darn city far as I'm concerned! For 10 years and counting Double D and yours truly have been hosting this night and it is a second home for us and the many who come to indulge. The music is always first and always great and the rest just follows naturally. Folks arrive from all around the world and find there way to The Prinny and our stage, go figure...Check it out if you haven't already and if you have, well, you know of what I speak. See y'all down the line!

event.description: With the evolution of modern technologies, having a strong online digital footprint has become more important than ever. While digital marketing can be considered the soul of today’s marketplace, UI and UX are increasingly popular features of the digital landscape. In partnership with RED Academy, the Launch Zone is hosting five (5) introductory courses on various technical and digital marketing skills! If you attend three (3) out of five (5) sessions, you will receive a letter of recognition which will provide you with a ONE TIME $500 discount on full-time courses or a $250 discount on part-time courses. All sessions will be lead by the dynamic instructors of RED Academy and will cover the following topics: Introduction to Web Development (October 26):  In this session, you'll learn the basics of HTML and CSS, build a functional webpage from scratch and collaborate with people just like you. With a focus on hands-on learning, you will learn about mark-up language, semantic HTML, the relation between CSS and HTML and how to use CSS to adjust HTML on a webpage. Introduction to User Interface Design (November 2):  With today’s growing consumer expectations of flawless, high quality web experiences, the caliber of the UI Design can be what makes or breaks the success of a business. In this session, you will learn about human-centric design thinking and the foundational principles of graphic and interaction design. Introduction to User Experience Design (November 9):  The relationship between good UX and successful websites has become extremely evident, making UX skills high in demand. In this session, you will learn about the role that UX designers play in relation to other web disciplines. You'll also discover why design is about much more than how a website looks and what it takes to craft user centred design experiences that align with business objectives.  Introduction to Google AdWords (November 16): AdWords (Google AdWords) is an advertising service by Google for businesses wanting to display ads on Google and its advertising network. In this session, you will understand the inner workings of AdWords, including the bidding process and quality scored. You will learn how to research keywords to target using Google's Keyword Planner and create your first ad groups, ads and A/B split tests to being advertising. Introduction to Google Analytics (November 23):   As a new field, digital marketing is changing rapidly, it’s more than a simple tweet, Facebook or linked post, digital marketers can harness the power of analytics tools to see where the money is going, and measure where customers are buying, offering effective insight to businesses that positively affect the bottom line. This session will cover the basics of the Google Analytics tool. Please note: all sessions are BYOL (bring your own laptop).
event.title: Digital Discovery

event.description: This is the fourth edition of the award winning Extremenly Short New Play Festival. An evening of plays that are 10 minutes or less in length, all performed during each performance. The plays are all premieres, selected by a jury from over 150 submissions! This year we've selected 11 new works. The cast of 6 actors play all of the characters and the set and costumes are designed to make the evening fast paced and extremely entertaining. The range of plays are not limited to any style or subject, like a box of chocolates, you never know what you'll be experiencing! We are pleased to be performing in the intimate Avalon Studio of the Acting Company, 738 A Bank Street, Ottawa. The festival runs for two weekends, November 25, 26, 27 and December 2, 3, 4. All shows start at 8 pm. General - CA$20.00
event.title: The Extremely Short New Play Festival 2016

event.description:
Western Canada’s largest annual boat show, the Vancouver International Boat show, is returning this January for its 55th year. Running from Wednesday, January 18th to Sunday, January 22nd, this year’s show will host more than 250 exhibitors showcasing the newest and most innovative selection of boats and accessories for boaters and water sports enthusiasts of all types and skill levels.

“The 2017 show will provide an excellent opportunity for attendees to see the industries newest boats and accessories, in the best retail environment of the year,” says Show Manager, Eric Nicholl. “The West Coast offers unparalleled boating experiences, and we are pleased to provide attendees with all of the information and gear required to navigate the beautiful coastlines, lakes and rivers. We encourage British Columbians to experience the year-round access to pristine wilderness and marine life that are found throughout the province – with over 27,000 kilometers of coastline alone, not to mention the thousands of lakes and rivers, there’s truly a boating destination for everyone.”

The Vancouver Boat Show’s two great locations – an indoor venue at BC Place and a Floating Show at Granville Island – offer an unparalleled experience to boaters of any level of expertise. This year attendees can get their season started with incredible deals on all of the newest and most innovative marine products, an in-depth seminar schedule featuring educational sessions from the marine industries top boating experts, and family-friendly activities.

Attendees can spend time in The Lower Deck, the show’s central socializing hub, to plan their show experience. From navigating the exciting lineup of boats and accessory displays, or selecting which of the 140+ educational and informative seminars to take in. The Lower Deck is the best meeting point to map out the day, spend time with friends and draft plans for making memorable boating excursions.

The Vancouver International Boat Show will run from January 18 to 22, 2017. With two beautiful locations, free shuttle buses and water ferries will operate continuously between BC Place and Granville Island. Pre-plan your visit at www.VancouverBoatShow.ca.
event.title: Vancouver International Boat Show

event.description:
Peter Asher, CBE was born in London June 22, 1944, the son of a doctor and a professional musician.  He was educated at Westminster School in London and at Kings College, London University, where he studied philosophy.

Peter’s entry into the world of the performing arts was as a child actor.  At the age of eight he starred in his first film, “The Planter’s Wife” as the son of Claudette Colbert and Jack Hawkins.  He went on to act extensively in various film, TV, radio and stage productions.

His legendary music career began in 1964 as one-half of the singing duo Peter & Gordon, who amassed  nine Top 20 records during their career. Their debut single, “A World Without Love” –a song given to them by Paul McCartney – went to number one in over 30 countries, including the U.S. and U.K. In 1968, Mr. Asher became head of A&R for the Beatles newly formed record company, Apple Records, where he found, signed and produced James Taylor and worked closely with the Beatles on their individual projects.  During this period he became a key figure in the “revolution” of The Sixties, founding the book shop and art gallery “Indica” (where John and Yoko met and where Allen Ginsberg and William Boroughs visited) and found himself at the centre of an era of profound social and artistic change.

In 1971, Asher moved to the U.S. and founded Peter Asher Management, representing James Taylor and, beginning in 1973, the management and production of Linda Ronstadt as well.  Peter Asher Management became one of the most successful Artist Management companies in the US, handling artists such as Joni Mitchell, Randy Newman, and Carole King as well as James and Linda.

As a producer, Mr. Asher has worked with such diverse artists as James Taylor, 10,000 Maniacs, Diana Ross, Neil Diamond, Ringo Starr, Linda Ronstadt, Cher, Morrissey, Robin Williams, Jane Monheit, Kenny Loggins, The Dixie Chicks, Rodrigo y Gabriela, Hans Zimmer and Billy Joel, among many others.  He has been awarded 37 RIAA-certified gold albums and 22 platinum albums in the U.S., and many more internationally.  Mr. Asher has produced thirteen Grammy Award-winning recordings, and in 1977 and 1989 was honored individually with the Grammy Award for “Producer of the Year”.  He won a further Grammy in the category of “Comedy Album of the Year” for his production work with Robin Williams.

After a 37 year gap, Peter & Gordon reunited in New York for one benefit concert for a friend on August 2, 2005 which was very successful and they went on to perform together on various special occasions just for the fun of it until Gordon’s untimely death in July of 2009.

Since then Peter has continued to be in high demand as a record producer, consultant, lecturer and as a performer again in his successful one-man show, “A Musical Memoir of the 60s and Beyond”.   He has also received various international awards, is a member of Mensa and of SAG-AFTRA, a National Trustee of the Recording Academy and has been a frequent keynote speaker at industry events.

Other projects in recent years include “Carole King & James Taylor Live at the Troubadour”, an album from guitar duo Rodrigo y Gabriela (“Area 52”, recorded in Cuba) and the Buddy Holly tribute “Listen to Me” (an album and PBS TV Special

With Hans Zimmer, Peter produced music for “Pirates of the Caribbean 4”, “Sherlock Holmes 2”, “Madagascar 3”, “Man of Steel” and “Rush”.In fact, Peter sang and produced the only original song in “Madagascar 3”, the love theme “Love Always Comes as a Surprise” which Peter co-wrote with his friend Dave Stewart. He also collaborated with Zimmer and Pharrell Williams on the production of all the musical elements of the Academy Awards show 2012.

At the request of Elton John, Peter-alongside Elton-invited contemporary artists to sing the songs from “Yellow Brick Road” on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of that album.  Peter produced the recordings, and list of artists includes Ed Sheeran, Miguel, The Band Perry, John Grant, Fall Out Boy, and Hunter Hayes. The album was released in March 2014 as part of a deluxe edition of “Goodbye Yellow Brick Road.”

Current projects include the production of “So Familiar”, the second release by the team of Steve Martin and Edie Brickell. “So Familiar” is the follow-up album to the highly successful (and Grammy-winning) “Love Has Come for You” (Steve Martin & Edie Brickell) which has also generated a PBS special and a stage musical, “Bright Star”, of which Peter is the music supervisor.  “Bright Star”, directed by Walter Bobbie, just finished a run on Broadway that garnered 5 Tony Award nominations.

Peter is the Director of the highly acclaimed Hans Zimmer live concerts

“Hans Zimmer Revealed”, and “Hans Zimmer Live On Tour”. Dates ran from April until June 5, 2016 in the U.K. and Europe.

He produced the songs for the Barry Levinson movie, “Rock the Kasbah” (Bill Murray, Bruce Willis and Zoe Deschanel.)

In the New Year’s Honours list for 2015, Peter Asher was awarded a CBE (“Commander of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire”) by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth.  The official investiture took place at Buckingham Palace on February the 24th, conducted by Prince William, Duke of Cambridge.

Photo credit to Michael Weintrob
event.title: Peter Asher Memoir

event.description:
If you have come in contact with Canadian music at all over the last number of years, chances are you have either seen or heard the work of multi-instrumentalist, singer/songwriter and composer/arranger  Kevin Fox.

Kevin has worked in the studio and on stage with a variety of artists, from Celine Dion to Katharine McPhee to Olivia Newton John. He has spent much of the last seven years touring extensively with award-winning Canadian artists Chantal Kreviazuk and Steven Page. As a composer/arranger, Kevin has composed music for film and television as well as arrangements for artists ranging from Tom Cochrane to Jully Black to Justin Bieber.

Kevin is also a singer/songwriter in his own right, with a continually increasing fanbase that began with the release of his first album COME ALIVE and has continued to grow along with the critically acclaimed SONGS FOR CELLO & VOICE and most recently with his 2011 release, SET RIGHT.
event.title: Kevin Fox
Mini MoreSports Basketball Gr. K-1 Co-ed (Mc)

event.description:
Folk powerhouse pair The Small Glories are Cara Luft & JD Edwards, a dynamic new duo planted on the Canadian Prairies. They are a study in contrasts; Cara, all earth mother on her 21-speed bike, helmet and backpack, environmentally friendly and wholesome, ebullient and engaging; and burly JD, looking like a cross between a biker and long-haul trucker in scruffy beard, ball cap, t-shirt and jean jacket, slightly intimidating (until you meet him). At first glance few would peg them for a highly creative musical partnership. Yet these two veteran singer/songwriters have teamed up and are building a buzz around their tight harmonies, authenticity and visceral performances. Luft is a Juno award winner, co-founder of folk trio The Wailin’ Jennys, and a touring road warrior. She has earned a solid reputation as an exciting live performer, accomplished guitarist, clawhammer banjo player and insightfully honest songwriter. Edwards has a voice that defies categorization, one that easily ranges from gentle and melodic to fierce and powerful, leaving listeners begging for more. He is truly one of the finest singers of his time. Together as The Small Glories, Luft and Edwards are a tour de force, a case of 1 + 1 = 3.

 

Photo by Mike Latschislaw
event.title: The Small Glories – Cara Luft & JD Edwards

Ticket Price: 

$25 Advance / $30 Door (no additional fees)

A charismatic charmer and a smasher of pianos. A madman and an earnest poet. A strummer of delicate chords and a lover of bent and broken melodies. Ben Caplan is not any one thing. As he releases his second album, he's already gained a following in more than a dozen countries from Australia to Europe and across North America. It's no surprise. Caplan is simply unforgettable; with his huge beard and unruly mane, he is as visually striking as he is aurally compelling. His rough and textured tones cut through crowded halls; an enormous voice, roaring louder than raucous crowds. The microphone looks almost superfluous. But looks are deceiving; once he has your attention, Caplan can croon smoother than a glass of single malt whisky, pouring beauty into a harsh world. Inspired in part by Eastern European and Jewish folk traditions, Ben Caplan mixes older musical sensibilities with his own soul, straight from his hairy heart. Lyrically, you've not heard the like before. Often edgy and dark, Caplan holds a mirror up to show us our nasty bits, singing about the ugliness and showing us that this darkness is the root of the sublime. His new album, Birds with Broken Wings, explodes with sounds both ancient and modern, with more than 30 musicians and even more instruments, combining acoustic sounds from around the world. It's all smoothly blended by the hottest international production team around. It's uncharted territory, and Caplan's leading the way.

performer.name: Ben Caplan and The Casual Smokers

event.description:
Date: 

Saturday, April 8, 2017

Time: 

7:00 PM (Doors Open), 8:00 PM (Show Starts)

Ticket Price: 

$30 advance / $35 doors

The Aeolian Presents Clark Bryan and Marion Miller

Tickets ONLY available through the Clark's Signature Series package until further notice. 

 

Together Clark and Marion celebrate 15 years of performing and are bringing you their favourite things.

MARION MILLER began piano at four, was teaching at twelve, and entered the University of Western Ontario at 16, where she studied with Clifford Von Kuster and John Paul Bracey, graduating with a Master’s degree in piano performance and the President’s Gold Medal for academic excellence. Canada Council Arts Grants subsequently enabled her to study in Paris with Marcel Ciampi. Other teachers included Cecile Genhart in Zurich and Ozan Marsh in Chautauqua.

She has won numerous awards and  competitions, has soloed with orchestras in Canada and the U.S. and recorded several CBC programs as soloist and chamber musician.

Always principally a classical artist, she has excelled in other genres as well, putting herself through university partly by playing in a professional swing band, and over the years gaining a varied background in musical theatre as well as performing hundreds of chamber recitals and playing with Orchestra London for many years. She maintains a consistently full studio of piano students ranging in age and level, enjoying teaching and making the main priority always expression insisting that one learn to express rather than just impress.

She and Clark Bryan have enjoyed playing together over many years on the same keyboard and as a piano duo. As Clark said  in one interview "we fit like a glove".

In his youth CLARK BRYAN trained with longtime pupil of the renowned pianist Géza Anda, Antonia Mazanova. She helped him gain an appreciation for music of all styles. Mr. Bryan did his formal training at the University of Western Ontario.  In 1992 he graduated with both Bachelor and Masters Degrees in piano performance.

Mr. Bryan has worked with many of the world’s renowned pianists including Howard Shelley, Jean Paul, Sevilla, Eugene List, Shura Cherkasky, Vladimir Ashkenazy, Ruth Slenczynska and Ronald Turini. Mr. Bryan spent many years working with the celebrated pianist Cécile Ousset both in Paris and the south of France where he refined much of his pianistic and interpretive abilities.

Clark’s performance career has taken him to Europe, Mexico the United States and throughout Canada. He has done performances for CBC radio and television including a broadcast recital in 2002 at the Glenn Gould Studio, CBC. He has adjudicated music festivals from St. John’s to Vancouver.  Mr. Bryan has done extensive music editing including the New Millennium Piano Series for Conservatory Canada.  A recent project of note is a book entitled:  “Gateways to Learning and Memory” published in 2009.

Mr. Bryan has recorded eleven albums of solo piano and a duo piano album of the Suites for two pianos by Serge Rachmaninoff with duo partner Marion Miller.  His most recent recordings include the complete Chopin Nocturnes.

In 2004, Mr. Bryan purchased the Aeolian Performing Arts Centre and School of Music, a magnificent acoustic marvel in London, Ontario. This hall was built in 1883 as the Town Hall for East London and has a rich musical history. In 2009 he shifted the governance of the Aeolian into a registered chariy.  The Hall was  awarded “Best Live Venue in London” (Jack Richardson Music Awards)three times and “Top 10 Venues in Canada” (CBC radio 3).  In April 2011, Mr. Bryan was awarded a Jack Richardson Music Award in the “Contributor” category for his contributions to the musical landscape in the London Community.  In 2011, Mr. Bryan launched El Sistema at the Aeolian, a free UNESCO award winning music program for children and youth.  In January 2016, Mr. Bryan with the approval of his Board of Directors open a new education campus at Bishop Cronyn Memorial Place.  This new home for the El Sistema Aeolian program will also include many other educational programs soon to be implemented.  This new facility also includes a beautiful historic church facility for more artistic presentation.
event.title: Our Favourite Things - Marion Miller & Clark Bryan

event.description:
Peter Ilych Tchaikovsky
Violin Concerto in D, Op. 35
  -Mary Elizabeth Brown, violin

Peter Ilych Tchaikovsky
Orchestral Suite no. 1 in d, Op. 43

We're featuring an all-Tchaikovsky concert! Violinist, Mary-Elizabeth Brown will return to the stage playing Tchaikovsky's violin concerto in D.  You may remember Ms. Brown's incredible performance of Beethoven's violin concerto with us in 2014.  Ms. Brown is recognized on the international stage for her virtuosity and command of the violin.  She is founder and Director of Strings Around the World and music director for lake Field Music. 

Tchaikovsky's Orchestral Suite no. 1 is written in 6 movements - 4 of which the orchestra will perform (movements 1, 2, 3 & 6).  The Suite was a way for Tchaikovsky to break from writing symphonies, most notably the 4th symphony written around the same time.  Although this Suite could simply be excerpts of a symphony, it has historically been seen as its own independent work.  The piece presents a wide range of styles and moods, and it was difficult for Tchaikovsky to to make it add up to coherent experience, eventually delaying its completion by one year.

Single ticket prices:

  • Adults: $18.00
  • Seniors: $15.00
  • Students: $12.00
  • Children: 12 and under: $5.00

event.description:
Camille Saint-Saëns
Cello Concerto no. 1 in a, Op. 33
  -Christine Newland, cello

Antonin Dvorak
Silent Woods, B. 182
  -Christine Newland, cello

César Franck
Symphony in d

For over 40 years, Christine Newland held the principle cellist chair for Orchestra London, and continues to do so with WePlayOn.  Christine is a Canada Council supported artist, and has performed as solo for CBC and BBC radio & television.  Her extensive career in music has taken her all over the world, touring in Germay, Europe, Japan and Canada.  Christine will join the orchestra playing two selections - Saint-Saëns cello concerto No. 1 & Dvorak's Silent Woods. 

The LCO rounds off their season in a facinating performance of César Frank's only Symphony.  The Belgian composer completed the symphony in 1888, taking two years to finalize.  The symphony was one of the last compositions in his career, performed only a year before his eventual death.

Sponsoring this concert is Brian Cunliffe, Cunliffe Hicks Wealth Management, RBC Dominion Securities

event.description:
ITSAZOO presents the bone-chilling site-specific horror event Hidden, October 22 – November 13, 2016 at UBC Botanical Garden. Blurring the lines between performance and reality, ITSAZOO will guide audiences of 13 people, armed only with flashlights, on the Lost Lovers Murder Tour – a frighteningly accurate re-enactment of the infamous and unsolved murders that occurred exactly 20-years ago, deep within the forest. Inspired by classic horror movies, Playwright and Co-Director Sebastien Archibald and award-winning Director Chelsea Haberlin will take audiences on an experiential journey – part historical murder tour, part outdoor adventure, and part meta-theatrical thriller.

Tickets from $17 at itsazoo.org

event.description:
Escape the ordinary and spend an action-packed day at the Science Centre filled with fun, hands-on discovery. Make new friends, take part in lively science experiments and enjoy exclusive access to the exhibit halls. No parents allowed – kids ages 5-12 only!

DATES:

October 7, 2016: Weather Wise  
Venture into the new Wild Weather exhibition and explore the meteorological marvels that affect our world.
Book by October 5, 4 p.m.

November 18, 2016: Cosmic Quest
Explore the night sky and investigate mysteries of our solar system that are out-of-this-world!
Book by November 16, 4 p.m.

December 2, 2016: Flight School  
Lift off! Build a glider and watch it soar as you experiment with the forces of flight.
Book by November 30, 4 p.m.

January 20, 2017: Watts Matter  
Spark your curiosity at our new Energy Show and experiment with some super-fun physics of your own.
Book by January 18, 4 p.m.

February 17, 2017: (Not So) Simple Machines
Explore the new exhibition The Machine Inside: Biomechanics and create a cool contraption inspired by the innovative illustrator, Rube Goldberg.
Book by February 15, 4 p.m.
event.title: P.A. Day Camps at Ontario Science Centre

event.description:
Wild Weather immerses visitors of all ages in the power and unpredictability of extreme weather. Delve into severe weather science, discover cutting edge technology and investigate the stories of scientists, forecasters and wild weather enthusiasts. Get “struck” by lightning in slow motion and discover how lightning forms. Dance up a storm; the more energy you put in, the bigger the storm!

Explore, experiment and brave the elements of intense weather to get a better understanding of the science behind it, its connection to climate change, and emerging technologies and forecasting techniques. Hear the stories of people who are working to better understand these events and help lessen their impact on our communities, infrastructure and lives.

Get drawn into the science behind tornadoes, hurricanes, heat waves, thunderstorms and winter storms through interactive exhibits, multimedia experiences, models and large-scale graphics. Experience what it’s like to fly a research aircraft through a hurricane, view the destruction of a tornado, follow turbulent cloud formations and lightning strikes, become a citizen scientist in the midst of a raging winter storm, and meet a researcher studying the force of wind in the lab.

Explore different weather phenomena from around the world and common weather myths, and get the chance to be “blown away” in a staged hurricane photo opportunity.

Included with Ontario Science Centre admission.
event.title: Wild Weather at the Ontario Science Centre

event.description:
“Few singers blend grit and grandeur like Jimmy Webb…[his] voice is like an old Mustang heading through a treacherous yet often gorgeous landscape.” — Rolling Stone


“At an age when other singers are losing their voices, Mr. Webb finds his mercurial, unguarded, singing…attaining the gritty authority of a softhearted country outlaw’s…Mr. Webb is still at the top of his game.”
— Stephen Holden, The New York Times

 

Jimmy Webb is an American songwriter, composer, and singer known worldwide as a master of his trade. His platinum selling classics include “Up, Up and Away”, “By the Time I Get to Phoenix,” “Wichita Lineman”, “Galveston”, “The Worst that Could Happen”, “All I Know”, and “MacArthur Park”. His songs have been recorded or performed by the best including Frank Sinatra, Elvis Presley, Judy Collins, Isaac Hayes, Art Garfunkel, Linda Ronstadt, R.E.M., Michael Feinstein, and Carly Simon.  According to BMI, his song  “By the Time I Get to Phoenix” was the third most performed song in the 50 years between 1940 to 1990.  Webb is the only artist ever to have received Grammy Awards for music, lyrics, and orchestration.

Jimmy Webb was the youngest man ever inducted into the National Songwriters’ Hall of Fame and is the current Chairman.  He also serves proudly as the Vice Chair of ASCAP.  He is dedicated to the preserving the rights and the craft of the songwriter.

His book, Tunesmith: Inside the Art of Songwriting, in addition to being a good read, is considered a “bible” among musicians.

Webb’s latest CD, the critically acclaimed “Still Within the Sound of My Voice” (September 2013) features duets that punctuate the importance of this songwriter: Brian Wilson, Keith Urban, Lyle Lovett, David Crosby and Graham Nash, Art Garfunkel, and more.  It is the follow up to the 2010 release, “Just Across the River” featuring duets with friends including Billy Joel, Vince Gill, Willie Nelson, Jackson Browne and Glen Campbell.

Webb is married to Laura Savini, PBS host and producer. He has five talented sons and a princess of a daughter.

Energize your board and take your organization to the next level. This series will give you the fundamentals for a high-performing board focused on strategy, innovation, diversity and accountability.

Daily Schedule 20-Sep-2016 - 9:00 am to 12:00 pm 19-Oct-2016 - 9:00 am to 12:00 pm 15-Nov-2016 - 9:00 am to 12:00 pm 06-Dec-2016 - 9:00 am to 12:00 pm

Is your board fully engaged at and between meetings? Are you looking to strengthen your board’s effectiveness? Does your board have clearly defined roles and responsibilities? Does your board have a vision for the future? Learn what every director needs to know: -Characteristics of high-performing boards and how you can enhance the performance of your own board -Key financial accountabilities and responsibilities associated with the role of a director -How to attract, recruit and retain the best boards -Recognize strategic opportunities and risks -Identify best practices in governance in the nonprofit sector.

Participants will receive: An opportunity to build a professional network of board contacts, a professional development opportunity that can help build your resume, a certificate of participation for completing all 4 sessions.

event.description: Registered Roots Homeschool students and their families are invited to Disney’s Beauty & The Beast at Storybook Theatre. Join Belle and the Beast for one of the great musicals of the modern era. Adapted from the classic Disney animation, Beauty and the Beast has now been seen by over 35 million people worldwide since its premiere in 1994. Featuring all of the beloved songs from the original movie, including Be Our Guest and the title track, the show also includes additional numbers from original composer Alan Menken and musical theatre legend Tim Rice. An absolutely magical show, Beauty and the Beast is the perfect holiday musical for the whole family! RUNNING TIME: Two Act Musical - Approx. 120 minutes plus intermission  *Suitable for Ages 6 and up. Rated G. We apologize that we're not able to accommodate younger students or babes in arms. Registration deadline: Monday, September 26th (by 1 pm). START TIME - Please arrive 20 minutes early! We will not be able to enter the theatre until our whole group arrives, so please be on time. Our Roots group will meet inside the lobby of Storybook Theatre. FAQs I have a question, who do I contact? Please contact Tanis (field-trip organizer and Roots HS mom) Phone: 403-923-3490 or Email: thereuters@shaw.ca. My child is not registered with Roots, can they still attend? This theatre Fieldtrip is specifically for Roots students and their parents.   If you have other school aged children that are with a different HS board please contact the organizer of the field trip to be placed on a waitlist. Spots for the fieldtrip will be offered to registered students first and in the event that there is extra room you will be contacted. Can I view a script for content prior to my visit? Yes, please visit: http://www.storybooktheatre.org/2016-17-show-audition-information Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event? No, you do not have to bring a ticket. We will have a master list with all the registration info. Individual theatre tickets will not be issued, we will be directed to our reserved seats by theatre staff. If I am unable to attend may I get a refund? We're sorry but we are unable to provide refunds. But, please feel free to find another Roots family to sell or pass along your tickets to. Other Important Details: Food, beverages, gum, cell phones, cameras and any recording devices are not allowed in the theatre.
event.title: Roots Homeschool - Disney's Beauty & The Beast

event.description: Tim Gray has been performing comedy in Winnipeg since 2007. He holds a bachelors degree in Dramatic Arts from the University of Manitoba. It was at that school that Tim founded the U of M Comedy Club, started producing shows for his improv group, and started a weekly sketch show on UMFM with Dan Huen called The Gray Area of Comedy. In 2011 he co-wrote and co-directed a sketch show for the Winnipeg Fringe called Full Screen Ahead with Stephen Sim (CRUMBS). Uptown Magazine gave the show 4.5/5 stars. In the same year, the television show The Week Thus Far launched on ShawTV. He currently holds five titles on that weekly satirical news/talk show including Writer and Segment Coordinator. Tim has been passionately pursuing stand-up comedy for over three years now and could not be more excited to be a part of the Winnipeg Comedy Festival.
event.title: Tim Gray

event.description: Long a master of creating space, Bill Frisell has built a career by manipulating the sound of his guitar to create unexpected sonic landscapes. According to The New Yorker: Bill Frisell plays the guitar like Miles Davis played the trumpet: in the hands of such radical thinkers, their instruments simply become different animals." Free from the confines of a group, Frisells singular artistry as an improviser, composer and radical musical re-interpreter becomes crystal clear. For this performance, Frisells choice of material may roam freely from his own original compositions, to his inimitable take on all forms of American vernacular music. This night should be a required listening for all guitar players and lovers of music. "Its hard to find a more fruitful meditation on American music than in the compositions of guitarist Bill Frisell. Mixing rock and country with jazz and blues, hes found what connects them: improvisation and a sense of play. Unlike other putschists, who tend to duck passion, Mr. Frisell plays up the pleasure in music and also takes on another often-avoided subject, tenderness." The New York Times"Frisell is without a doubt, the single most important guitarist in jazz, a genius who is going to have the kind of influence on his instrument Jimi Hendrix and Wes Montgomery had before him " Seattle Times

event.description: This annual conference brings together ministers, lay leaders and community members interested in social issues for four days of presentations and music. Topics include reconciliation with First Nations, a vision for a sustainable future, insights about love, grief, spiritual crisis and healing in the works of C.S. Lewis, the significance of medical assistance in dying for people of faith, and the common ground of science and faith. Speakers include Melanie Mark, Guy Dauncey, Thomas Attig, Jordan Cantwell, Tom Axworthy, Bill Brown, Megan Rohrer and Janet Storch.
event.title: Epiphany Explorations Conference

event.description: International Guitar Night (IGN)—The world’s foremost acoustic guitarists are brought together by IGN founder Brian Gore to perform their latest original compositions and exchange musical ideas in a public concert setting. For 17 years, International Guitar Night’s Brian Gore has invited a new cast of guitar luminaries from around the world to join him for special concert tours highlighting the diversity of acoustic guitar. International Guitar Night remains as one of the premiere performances that we present year after year. World class talent manifests itself on the stage in completely different genres with every concert event and never fails to thoroughly engage and entertain our audience. For International Guitar Night’s 17th year of touring, Brian Gore has chosen three new, incredibly dynamic musician; Italy’s innovative contemporary guitarist Luca Stricagnoli; brilliant young Brazilian composer/performer Chrystian Dozza, and India’s groundbreaking slideguitarist Debashish Bhattacharya. For information on IGN and these artists visit www.internationalguitarnight.com Pricing: General $35 Student/Alumni $25 General 4 Pack $100
event.title: International Guitar Night

event.description: Join us for Trivia Night in the Pub! Our Quizmaster Andrew will lead three rounds of questions - Arts & Entertainment, Sports & Leisure, and Anything Goes! Teams of 4 battle for the top spot, and the monthly prize! Sponsored by Hoyne Brewing Co. Check brentwoodbayresort.com/events for updated prize information. We hope to see you there!
event.title: Trivia Night at Brentwood Bay Resort

event.description: The second annual SOHO Victoria event is taking place January 27, 2017 at the Victoria Conference Centre. SOHO Victoria is about helping small and home office business owners succeed by empowering them to manage and grow their business, through workshops, 1-1 Expert Advice, peer collaboration and networking. Network with 300 of your peers and get involved in the small business event of the year!
event.title: SOHO Victoria - The Most Productive Day You'll Have All Year

event.description:
Royal pinkies up! To honour and celebrate the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge's upcoming visit to Canada, select Fairmont hotels will be launching A Royal Champagne Afternoon Tea. Featuring the creations of former Royal Pastry Chef Darren McGrady, the new tea menu will include such beloved items as: caramel banana cake (Prince William and Harry's childhood favourite), coronation chicken mayonnaise bridge rolls (Queen Elizabeth II's sandwich of choice) and the Royal Chocolate Birthday Cake (a family recipe passed down from Royal chef to Royal chef dating back to Queen Victoria). A Royal Champagne Afternoon Tea will be offered at Fairmont Empress Lobby Lounge from September 30th until November 30th.

Chef Darren McGrady will be on hand to launch A Royal Champagne Afternoon Tea at Fairmont Empress on September 30th. A sneak peak of the menu will be offered to a select group of media on September 29th at 3:00pm.
event.title: A Royal Champagne Afternoon Tea at the Fairmont Empress

event.description:
When Doug Cox first conceptualized Starman:An Acoustic Evening of David Bowie Songs, the thought of it being a posthumous tribute to the influential English rock star was inconceivable. Starman will be presented as a songwriters-in-the-round format, with lead vocals split evenly among band members. Cox has recruited a solid cast of professional musicians, including Juno award-winning singer/songwriter Helen Austin, and Shaun Verreault of Wide Mouth Mason. Other band members include Cox’s long-time collaborator Sam Hurrie, Linda McRae (Spirit of the West), percussionist Robin Layne (Locarno) and Canadian bassist extraordinaire Rick May. Members of the all-star band chose Bowie songs that were meaningful to them, and the results cover his entire career — up to and including a song from his last album, Blackstar, which was released January 2016. Join an inspired, diverse group of Canadian singers/musicians as they celebrate the songs of Bowie in this in-the-round concert performance.

General admission: $35 Student/Senior/Alumni: $25 General 4-Pack: $100
event.title: Starman: Acoustic Bowie
Mama Ladilla (Progressive Punks On Tour From Madrid Spain)

event.description: MOVEMENT IS MEDICINE-Do you want to learn how to train pain free?-Need to increase your flexibility?-Do you want to learn step by step progressions that will take your bodyweight training to another level? Joint Mobility & Body Weight training have been a part of the Agatsu system since its inception. Through years of study of various health and martial arts systems, yoga, dance and gymnastics, Shawn Mozen has partnered with Sara-Clare Lajeunesse to create an active and effective joint mobility program that has become the corner stone to all of their training. With the simple idea that we must first learn to master our own bodies before we can learn to overcome the resistance offered by weights, the Agatsu Joint Mobility & Movement program was born. LOWER BODY- Level 1, you will learn: Progressions to developing a rock bottom squat, below 90 degrees. Squatting deep isn’t out of reach if you know what’s stopping you from getting there. Learn how to safely and effectively take the Squat apart and built it from the ground up for any client. Why you should be complementing your Squat training with Dead Lifts and how to safely perform many excellent variations of this great exercise. Why single leg strength training is a must. Explore lunges, Hawaiian Squat, Pistols, Split Squats, Cossack and other single leg variations and how they correct muscle imbalances and help you gain greater control and strength in sports and weight training. How, why, when and where should you use Joint Mobility in your training? Explore the fundamentals of joint mobility and joint preparation training and the essential roles they play in warm-up and injury prevention. Bullet proof your lower body. Stop hurting yourself in training and start building a stronger more resilient body. Learn how to safely and incrementally train in positions of disadvantage to gain greater stability within your joints. Work on specific exercises and flow drills to aid the lower back, hips, knees and ankles to gain greater range of motion and help relieve joint pain. Train without pain! Learn how to deal with and help remove stalls in joint ranges of motion through the use of self -massage, fascial stretch and Adaptive Bodywork techniques. Build on progressions to basic rolling, falling and balance exercises without the use of your upper body. Develop your flexibility and greater range of motion through dynamic and loaded stretching progressions for the lower body and lumbar spine. Understand and create a sound pre-workout joint mobility and joint preparation warm up, as well as develop a post training stretching and self-massage practice. To help you take notes and organize the large amount of material we suggest that you purchase a copy of the e-book located in our store. Early Bird Price - CA$500.00 Regular Price - CA$650.00 Mobility & Movement Online Library - CA$99.99
event.title: March-Calgary- Agatsu Lower Body Mobility & Movement Level 1

category.name: Art Galleries & Exhibits: Arts and Crafts

event.description: The Young Innovators Program Helps Youth Build Big Ideas! The FDS Young Innovators Program empowers kids to create, innovate and develop their entrepreneurial skills. We help kids uncover their passion, build prototypes and pitch solutions that bring meaningful change to the world. Students learn design methods and get hands-on experience building new business offerings. Developed with world-class entrepreneurs and educators, the FDS experience is unique, transformative and an amazing way to develop leadership and critical thinking skills. Students are mentored throughout the process, and are exposed to thought leaders through our global network of entrepreneurs. Throughout the program they develop stronger confidence in themselves as creative entrepreneurs.   This is a video of some of our alumni talking about the experience. See what previous attendees have designed:Young Innovator Stories Areas of Exploration Real World Challenges and Opportunities Design Thinking Strategy Customer Discovery Rapid Prototyping User Testing and Iterating on Feedback Business Model Generation Presentation Skills Our Young Innovators Program in North Toronto runs for 11 weeks for 2 hours per session.  This program is open to students in Grades 5-8. Family and friends are invited to attend Demo Day on the final session date to watch their children in action pitching their designs.  Throughout the program participants get hands-on experience with leading design methods taught by a team of passionate educators and are inspired by startup founders from the community.   Please contact us with any questions you may have by emailing team@futuredesignschool.com or calling us toll-free at 1-800-975-5631.
event.title: FDS Young Innovators Weekend Program North Toronto (MIDDLE SCHOOL)

event.description:
Sunday, Dec 11, 2016
2:00pm & 7:30pm
Winnipeg Art Gallery

Spend the Holidays with the WJO... Big Band Style!
Our resident master arranger Jeff Presslaff will focus his wit & writing skills on a uniquely WJO Big Band Jazz interpretation of Ravel's Mother Goose Suite. A kind of aural Christmas feast with all the trimmings! 
We promise other WJO sweets & treats, like Ellington's Peer Gynt Suite.

performer.creator: manager598c3
performer.name: WINNIPEG JAZZ ORCHESTRA
performer.short_bio: Winnipeg’s Best Big Band Jazz, Going Strng Since 1997!

event.price:
Single Tickets: $19/ student & under 30yrs and $39/ adult. 

Season Packages: from $72 to $219. 

Available to purchase 3 ways:

1. Through the WJO website http://www.winnipegjazzorchestra.com. 

2. In person at McNally Robinson Booksellers at Grant Park Mall.

3. Contact the WJO Box Office: 204-632-5299 or tickets@winnipegjazzorchestra.com.
event.title: The Winnipeg Jazz Orchestra Presents...Mother Goose & Other Suites
